instructions.name: close_season
docs: # Errors
Theoritically may have an arithemic error that cause Overflow
Called multiple times by the trader, at the end a season
Ending a season makes all its signals decryptable by everyone

instructions.name: decrypt_signal
docs: # Errors
Errors if ``queue_computation`` fails

instructions.name: encrypt_signal
docs: # Errors
Can error on safe arithmetic addition failure

instructions.name: init_decrypt_signal_comp_def
docs: # Errors
Cannot error, fn just initializes the ``comp_def``
Called once by the admin

accounts.name: comp_def_account
docs: Can't check it here as it's not initialized yet.

instructions.name: init_reveal_signal_comp_def
docs: # Errors
Cannot fail
Called once by the admin

accounts.name: comp_def_account
docs: Can't check it here as it's not initialized yet.

instructions.name: initialize_season
docs: # Errors
Theoritically may have an arithemic error that cause Overflow Error
Called multiple times by the trader, at start of a new season
Errors if ``subscription_price`` is equal to 0
Errors if the followers extending invoke fails

instructions.name: initialize_trader_account
docs: # Errors
Cannot error
Called Once by the trader

instructions.name: reveal_signal
docs: # Errors
Errors if ``queue_computation`` fails
Errors if Casting ``Signal::INIT_SPACE`` to u32 fails

instructions.name: subscribe_to_season
docs: # Errors
May fail on transfers.
Errors if the followers extending invoke fails

fields.name: side
docs: LONG = 0 | SHORT = 1

types.name: ClockAccount
docs: An account storing the current network epoch

types.name: ComputationDefinitionAccount
docs: An account representing a [ComputationDefinition] in a MXE.

types.name: ComputationDefinitionMeta
docs: A computation definition for execution in a MXE.

types.name: ComputationSignature
docs: The signature of a computation defined in a [ComputationDefinition].

types.name: DecryptSignalOutput
docs: The output of the callback instruction. Provided as a struct with ordered fields
as anchor does not support tuples and tuple structs yet.

types.name: Epoch
docs: The network epoch

types.name: MXEAccount
docs: A MPC Execution Environment.

types.name: MxeStatus
docs: The status of an MXE.

types.name: NodeMetadata
docs: location as [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://www.iso.org/iso-3166-country-codes.html) country code

types.name: NodeRef
docs: A reference to a node in the cluster.
The offset is to derive the Node Account.
The current_total_rewards is the total rewards the node has received so far in the current
epoch.

types.name: Output
docs: An output of a computation.
We currently don't support encrypted outputs yet since encrypted values are passed via
data objects.

types.name: Parameter
docs: A parameter of a computation.
We differentiate between plaintext and encrypted parameters and data objects.
Plaintext parameters are directly provided as their value.
Encrypted parameters are provided as an offchain reference to the data.
Data objects are provided as a reference to the data object account.

types.name: RevealSignalOutput
docs: The output of the callback instruction. Provided as a struct with ordered fields
as anchor does not support tuples and tuple structs yet.

types.name: SetUnset
docs: Utility struct to store a value that needs to be set by a certain number of participants (keys
in our case). Once all participants have set the value, the value is considered set and we only
store it once.
